file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-42-02-04 - NOSE LANDING GEAR TAXI LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOSE LANDING GEAR TAXI LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the nose-landing-gear taxi light lamp and the nose-landing-gear taxi light assembly. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT LAMP ALL 33-42-02-000-801-A - REMOVAL NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT LAMP ALL 33-42-02-400-801-A - INSTALLATION NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT AS- ALL 33-42-02-000-802-A SEMBLY - REMOVAL NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT AS- ALL 33-42-02-400-802-A SEMBLY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-42-02 Page 1 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-42-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the nose-landing-gear taxi light lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 51-0831-1 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose landing gear D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Commercially available Cloth which does not release lints AR RTV-157 Adhesive/Sealant AR MEP 13-073 Cleaning solvent (Rhodiasolve E-23) AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Gasket 51-0831-1 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the nose landing gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the TAXI switch, on the overhead panel, is in the OFF position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-42-02 Page 2 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT PRE-MOD S.B. 145-33-0028 AND PRE-MOD S.B. 145-33-0034 (1) Remove the four nuts (1), screws (4), and tubings (3). If they are damaged, remove the tubings (3) from the four screws (4) and discard them. (2) Remove the lamp retainer (6). (3) Carefully remove the lamp (5). (4) Remove the two screws (2) from the two terminals (7). (5) Remove the lamp (5) from the light assembly (8). K. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT POST-MOD S.B. 145-33-0028 OR POST-MOD S.B. 145-33-0034 (1) Remove the four nuts (1), screws (4) and tubings (3). If they are damaged, remove the tubings (3) from the four screws (4) and discard them. (2) Remove the lamp retainer (6). (3) Carefully remove the lamp (5). (4) Remove the two screws (2) from the two terminals (7). (5) Remove the lamp (5) from the light assembly (8). If they are damaged, replace the gasket from the light assembly (8) as follows: (a) Use a plastic spatula to remove all damaged gaskets from the light assembly (8). (b) Use a clean cloth moist with cleaning solvent to remove old adhesive residues from the light assembly (8). WARNING: AIR PRESSURE MUST NOT BE OF MORE THAN 30 PSI (270 KPA). OR INJURY OR DEATH TO PERSONNEL CAN OCCUR. (c) Dry the parts with compressed air or wipe them with a clean cloth and let them air-dry. WARNING: ADHESIVE IS VERY FLAMMABLE. DO NOT INHALE ITS VAPORS AND DO NOT LET IT TOUCH YOUR SKIN. OBEY THE FIRE PRECAUTIONS. (d) Apply adhesive to the new gasket/light assembly (8) interface. (e) Put the gasket on the light assembly (8). Use a clean cloth to remove excess adhesive. Let it air-dry for 4 hours. (f) Do steps (d) through (e) again, as necessary for the remaining three gaskets. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-42-02 Page 3 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT PRE-MOD S.B. 145-33-0028 AND PRE-MOD S.B. 145-33-0034 Nose-Landing-Gear Taxi Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 711 DET. A 1 TORQUE OF 1.12-1.35 Nm (10-12 lbf.in) 8. LIGHT ASSEMBLY 7. TERMINAL (2) 1. NUT (4) 6. LAMP RETAINER 2. SCREW (2) 3. TUBING (4) 1 4. SCREW (4) DET. B 5. LAMP 145AMM330099.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-42-02 Page 4 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT POST-MOD S.B. 145-33-0028 OR POST-MOD S.B. 145-33-0034 Nose-Landing-Gear Taxi Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A ZONE 711 DET. A 1 TORQUE OF 1.12-1.35 Nm (10-12 lbf.in) 8. LIGHT ASSEMBLY 7. TERMINAL (2) 1. NUT (4) GASKET (REF.) 6. LAMP RETAINER 2. SCREW (2) 3. TUBING (4) 1 4. SCREW (4) DET. B 5. LAMP 145AMM330688.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-42-02 Page 5 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-42-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the nose-landing-gear taxi light lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-42-00-700-801-A/500 TAXI LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST TU-365 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose landing gear D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench (For the torque range, To torque the fasteners correctly available refer to Figure 401 and Figure 402) E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tubing TU-365 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the nose landing gear I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) NOTE: Before you install the two terminals (7), make sure that the wires are sufficiently loose to prevent wire rupture during the subsequent removal operation. Install the two terminals (7) with the screws (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-42-02 Page 6 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Install the lamp (5). (3) Put the four screws (4) through the holes in the lamp retainer (6) and move the tubing (3) over the screw (4) threads. (4) Install the lamp retainer (6). (5) Tighten the four screws (4) and nuts (1) to the specified value. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the operational test of the lamp that you installed to the nose-landing-gear taxi light assembly ( AMM TASK 33-42-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-42-02 Page 7 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-42-02-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the nose-landing-gear taxi light assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AFM-145/( ) CONFIGURATION DEVIATION LIST - NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT LAMP - REMOV- AMM TASK 33-42-02-000-801-A/400 AL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose landing gear D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To supply hot air to the heat-shrinkable Heat Gun Available sleeve F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-I-23053 Heat-shrinkable Sleeve RNF-100 3/8-9 AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the nose landing gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure the TAXI switch, on the overhead panel, is in the OFF position. (2) Remove the nose-landing-gear taxi light lamp ( AMM TASK 33-42-02-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-42-02 Page 8 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 403) (Figure 404) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) With a plastic spatula, remove the sealant from around the bolts (2) and (3) and nuts (5) and (7). (2) Remove the bolt (3), washer (4), and nut (5). (3) Remove the bolt (2), washer (6), and nut (7). (4) Remove the conduit nut (10), washer (11), grommet (12), and electrical cable (9). (5) Remove the nose-landing-gear taxi light assembly (1). (6) To operate the aircraft with a taxi light removed (refer to AFM-145/( ) CONFIGURATION DEVIATION LIST), it is necessary to do these procedures at the terminal lugs: CAUTION: AN INCORRECTLY INSULATED WIRE CAN CAUSE SHORT CIRCUITS AND DAMAGE TO THE AIRCRAFT. (a) Cover each terminal with two heat-shrinkable sleeves. Wait for the first sleeve to cool down before you install the other. (b) To prevent chafing, make a loop with the sleeved end of the wire and attach it back to itself. CAUTION:A LOOSE WIRE CAN BE DAMAGED AND THEN CAUSE SHORT CIRCUITS AND DAMAGE TO THE AIRCRAFT. (c) Attach the loose wire to the LH steering cylinder. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-42-02 Page 9 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT PRE-MOD S.B. 145-33-0028 AND PRE-MOD S.B. 145-33-0034 Nose-Landing-Gear Taxi Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 403 B A ZONE 711 12. GROMMET 10. CONDUIT NUT 11. WASHER 1. LIGHT ASSEMBLY DET. C DET. A 2. BOLT 3. BOLT C 9. ELECTRICAL CABLE 4. WASHER 1 8. BOLT 5. NUT DET. B 6. WASHER 1 TORQUE: 9,6-10,7 Nm (85-95 lbf.in) 7. NUT 145AMM330091D.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-42-02 Page 10 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT POST-MOD S.B. 145-33-0028 OR POST-MOD S.B. 145-33-0034 Nose-Landing-Gear Taxi Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 404 13. LOCKWIRE B A ZONE 711 VIEW - D 12. GROMMET 2 10. CONDUIT NUT DET. A 11. WASHER 1. LIGHT ASSEMBLY DET. C 2. BOLT 3. BOLT C D 9. ELECTRICAL CABLE PIN 4. WASHER 1 8. BOLT 5. NUT 1 DET. B TORQUE: 9,6-10,7 Nm (85-95 lbf.in) 6. WASHER 2 FOR AIRCRAFT POST-MOD S.B. 145-33-0034 7. NUT 145AMM330689B.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-42-02 Page 11 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-42-02-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the nose-landing-gear taxi light assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-42-00-700-801-A/500 TAXI LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST NOSE-LANDING-GEAR TAXI LIGHT LAMP - INSTAL- AMM TASK 33-42-02-400-801-A/400 LATION S.B.145-33-0034 - SRM 51-20-01/1 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 711 Nose landing gear D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-81733 TYPE II CLASS 1, -1/2 Sealant AR MS20995C20 Lockwire AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the nose landing gear I. Installation (Figure 403) (Figure 404) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU CUT THE HEAT-SHRINKABLE SLEEVE NOT TO CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE WIRE. (1) If necessary, remove the protection from the terminal lugs. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-42-02 Page 12 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) (PRE-MOD S.B.145-33-0034) Make sure that the bolt (8) is tight. If it is not, tighten the bolt (8) to the specified torque value. (3) (POST-MOD S.B.145-33-0034) Make sure that the bolt (8) is tight and that the lockwire (13) is in good condition. If necessary, do as follows: (a) Cut the lockwire (13) from the bolt (8). (b) Tighten the bolt (8) to the specified torque value. (c) Use a lockwire (13) to lock the bolt (8). (4) Install the nose-landing-gear taxi light assembly (1). (5) Install the bolt (2), washer (6), and nut (7). (6) Install the bolt (3), washer (4), and nut (5). (7) Install the conduit nut (10), washer (11), grommet (12), and electrical cable (9). (8) Apply sealant MIL-PRF-81733 TYPE II CLASS 1, -1/2 (SRM 51-20-01/1) along the contour of the bolts (2) and (3) and nuts (5) and (7). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Install the nose-landing-gear taxi light lamp ( AMM TASK 33-42-02-400-801-A/400). (2) Do the operational test of the lamp installed in the nose-landing-gear taxi light assembly ( AMM TASK 33-42-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-42-02 Page 13 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
